column1:
JoshuaMauk,"2014-01-06T12:11:46.087Z","Zoom, zoom, zoom!","

I received this set for Christmas from my wife and it was a big surprise as I had not seen it yet on any of my Target or LEGO Store trips.
column2: It was wrapped in a nice red wrapping paper that came free with LEGO Store purchases.&nbsp

column1: <li>The overall set is a great idea and a fun concept.&nbsp
column2: It feels less like a getaway chase and more like a round of Mario Kart.&nbsp
column4: is my name for a Batmobile roadster).&nbsp
column6: cute but could have been an even cooler Ratrod type vehicle with only a few parts being swapped out.&nbsp
column7: I feel like DC villain vehicles need to be as heavily decorated and modified as their drivers tend to be.&nbsp

column1: <li>Building the set was fun as most of the bat mobiles have been.&nbsp
column2: I think there is a need for a bat vehicle with a trans light blue canopy.&nbsp
Anytime we get Justice League Characters thrown into batman sets, I am a happy camper.&nbsp
column3: I think there was a missed opportunity to include a Bright Red with Yellow Highlights Speedorz Piece for Flash to blast past Bats and Riddler to win the race.&nbsp
column4: I really hope to see more JLA characters in upcoming sets.&nbsp
column5: We need a Martian Manhunter, Cyborg, Hawkman and Hawkgirl, and about a hundred other pretty awesome mini figures.&nbsp
column6: The new Batman design is fantastic and is a nice change to the 90&#39
column7: s Keaton we keep getting in DC sets.&nbsp

column1: I say this is a must buy.
column2: The Flash figure alone is worth the price and getting new Batman and new Riddler designs are a bonus.&nbsp

,TRUE,3,3,5,5,4 TeraMedia","2014-07-24T04:23:50.47Z","Could have taken it to the next level... but didn't","

LEGO had an opportunity to make this a phenomenal set, but instead it seems like there was a lot of make-do and tack-on.

column3: I get the sense that this model was an add-on that the marketing department made LEGO do, after seeing the batmobile model prototype.&nbsp
column8: Parts fall off or out when you try to play with it.&nbsp
column10: t even seem to be the same scale as the batmobile.

column3: The wheels are nice, and the way they did the engine cowls in the back is pretty slick.&nbsp
column4: It is clear that a lot of time was spent on the aesthetics of this design.

column1: But not great... the build-design of the batmobile seems to indicate that they were trying to make the one from one of the movies where the sides blew off and it ended up as
column2: a skinny car with a narrow wheel-base.&nbsp
column3: Indeed, the sides on this model are held on by pairs of technic pegs, and come off easily.&nbsp
column4: Inside of the front wheels are&nbsp
column5: a pair of thin disks (brakes?) that could have been done as separate &quot
column8: My guess is that they ran into some design hurdles that they couldn&#39
column9: t overcome, and gave up on the transformability concept in favor of appearance.&nbsp
column10: But that would have been a cool model if they had pulled it off!

column1: If you buy this set for the models it makes, consider whether you would pay the price for the batmobile alone, and base your decision on that.
